isis.stitle: 13 SPEED AND 18 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO-713/18 SERIES - INSTALL - SPLITTER CYLINDER ASSEMBLY

note.para: Apply Eaton lubricant #71214 or equivalent to all shift cylinder assembly and insert valve O-rings so a film covers the entire surface of each O-ring.
Apply Eaton rust preventative #71213 or equivalent to all shift cylinder walls and yoke bars. Cover the entire yoke bar surface that comes in contact with the shift cylinder O-ring.

step1.para: If previously removed, install the small O-ring in the cylinder housing bore ( Figure 241).

figure.caption: Figure 241. Install O-Ring in Cylinder Housing Bore

step1.para: If previously removed, install the piston O-ring on the piston O.D.
Place the shift yoke in the splitter sliding clutch slot.
Position the sliding clutch and yoke in the auxiliary housing. One hand will need to hold the sliding clutch against the rear auxiliary drive gear until the splitter yoke nut has been installed.
Position a new gasket on the cylinder housing mounting surface ( Figure 242).
With the air passage towards the rear bearing cover, install the cylinder housing ( Figure 242).
If previously removed, install the insert valve (nipple in the proper direction) in the cylinder cover bore ( Figure 243).
If previously removed, install the insert valve retaining nut over the insert valve ( Figure 243). Tighten the nut to 40 to 50 ft-lbs. (54 to 68 N·m).
Install the O-ring inside the cylinder housing over the yoke bar end ( Figure 244).
Install the splitter cylinder piston with the recessed side up ( Figure 244).
Install 3/4" lock nut and tighten to 70 to 85 ft-lbs. (95 to 115 N·m) ( Figure 244).
Position a new gasket on the cylinder housing cover mounting surface ( Figure 245). The gasket air passage must align with the housing air passage.

figure.caption: Figure 245. Position Splitter Cylinder Cover Over Gasket

step1.para: Position the splitter cylinder cover over the gasket ( Figure 245).
Apply Eaton sealant #71205 or Loctite 242 to the retaining bolts ( Figure 245).
Install and tighten the retaining bolts to 20 to 25 ft-lbs. (27 to 34 N·m) ( Figure 245).
